page.title: 18VELVET BOTTOM NATURE RESERVE
page.content: Velvet Bottom is owned by the{BRISTOL {WATERWORKS COMPANY}and is managed by {SOMERSET TRUST FOR NATURE {CONSERVATION (STNC).}It's unusual ecology has led to it's designation as an area of {SPECIAL SCIENTIFIC {INTEREST,}which gives it special legal protection.It is a dry valley 2km long.High levels of lead, some from pre-Roman times,mean that the vegetation is very distinctive.No trees are able to grow here and the range of plants is small-mainly grasses,sedges & horsetails.Orchids flower in May & June.Adders & lizards are numerous in the dry grassland Badgers,rabbits,stoats and weasels are also found here.Conservation in an area of much distintive wildlife and industrial archaeology is vital.
